byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and WILLIAM NEUMAN

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio described the designation amid mounting scrutiny over City Hall’s shielding of communications with one of his closest advisers.

headline.print_headline: Mayor Is Pressed to Clarify Role for a New Class of Adviser: ‘Agent of the City’
headline.main: De Blasio Pressed to Clarify New Adviser Role: ‘Agent of the City’

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio described the designation amid mounting scrutiny over City Hall’s shielding of communications with one of his closest advisers.
abstract: Government watchdog groups, including Citizens Union, press New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio to clarify role of advisers he designates as 'agents of the city'; designation comes during mounting scrutiny over de Blasio administration's policy of shielding communications between mayor's office and such consultants; critics note that each of five advisers close to mayor, while unpaid, represents firms paid by Campaign for One New York, political nonprofit organization connected with de Blasio.
